title: Don’t let the crows guide your routes
High-Performance Java Persistence Newsletter, Issue 25
Improving the developer experience for Headlamp plugins
description:
We released Headlamp (a generic Kubernetes web UI) last November with one of its core features being “frontend plugins”. These are extensions whose purpose is to offer extra functionality that is not available in Headlamp by default.
Plugins are written in Typescript (or Javascript), compiled into a single module using webpack , and loaded by Headlamp’s backend which makes them available for the frontend to dynamically load.
The process above works well and is transparent to Headlamp’s users.

title: Monorepo Support Is Now Generally Available
One Place Now | The First 100 Days and Beyond: A Look at Health Care Policy Under the Biden Administration
description:
One Place Now | The First 100 Days and Beyond: A Look at Health Care Policy Under the Biden Administration carolyn.barnic… Tue, 04/06/2021 - 15:24

President Biden and Vice President Harris campaigned on a health care plan that would build on the Affordable Care Act (ACA) with such priorities as expanded ACA premium subsidies, the addition of a “public option” health plan to the individual market and a Medicare “buy in” program.

During this session, health care policy experts will examine progress the Biden Administration has made in its first 100 days to execute on that plan, providing insight into how changes could affect employers, brokers and insurance carriers. In addition to the ACA, they’ll review other health care legislation impacting these groups in

title: Quick Tip: How to Loop Through a JSON Response in JavaScript
Sponsored Post: Failover Conf!, Kinsta, Bridgecrew, IP2Location, StackHawk, InterviewCamp.io, Educative, Stream, Fauna, Triplebyte
description:
Fun and Interesting Events

  • Since we’re all feeling the fatigue of staring at screens all year, we’re switching things up at this year’s Failover Conf! This one-day conference will be featuring LIVE fireside chats and keynotes where you’ll be able to get your questions answered in real time. You’ll also hear from a variety of industry experts in our two panel discussions. And when you need a break, take a load off and watch some cartoons or listen to music in the breakout rooms where you can jump in and chat with other attendees or just sit back and relax. Join your peers for this virtual experience on April 27 from 9am - 3:30pm PDT.

title: The Journey to Understanding your Insurance Customers
The State of Employee Benefits 2021: The Story Behind the Data
description:
The State of Employee Benefits 2021: The Story Behind the Data carolyn.barnic… Tue, 04/06/2021 - 15:21

The full impact of COVID-19 on employer-sponsored benefits plans is still uncertain. So how, and to what extent, did this influence benefit plan offerings and employee enrollment decisions in 2021?

Join Benefitfocus Chief Data Officer, John Thomas and Director of Customer Advocacy, Misty Guinn for a deep dive into the key insights from our State of Employee Benefits 2021 report. With a look back at actual enrollment data leading up to, and following the onset of COVID-19, you'll hear a unique perspective on trends and opportunities in: benefit offerings and participation, consumer-driven health care strategy and COVID-19 impacts on health plan cost-sharing.

title: Video: Latest Developments: Dispatches From the HubSpot Product Team
description: Every week at HubSpot, we put on an internal event called Tech Talk, where our engineers share all the latest about what they’ve been up to and their peers get a firsthand look at the future of the HubSpot product.
